JavaSort is an algorithm used in the Java programming language, implemented by calling the java.util.Arrays.sort() method. For Java versions >= 7.0, this method performs several checks to determine the most efficient sorting approach. In most cases, it uses a variation of the quicksort algorithm known as Yaroslavskiy Dual-Pivot Quicksort algorithm. For details about this method see a documented Java 7 or Java 8 source code.

Time complexity: an average time complexity of the algorithm is Θ(nlog(n)) while the worst-time complexity is Θ(n2).

References

  • Vladimir Yaroslavskiy. Dual-Pivot Quicksort algorithm, 2009
  • Documented Java 7 or Java 8 source code of java.util.Arrays.sort() method.
